oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civil wars; Portrait photographs; Military uniforms; Mustaches; Beards; Clothing & dress; Soldiers
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; United States - Army - Quartermaster Corps; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oval bust length portrait of Col. Jno. C. Crane, Inspector of Quarter Master's Department, in uniform. The portrait is signed, "Respectfully your [illegible], Jno. C. Crane, Col. Inspector Quartermaster Department. January 1, 1865." "James F. Rusling, Nash." is written in pencil on the lower front left corner outside the portrait area.
The Quartermaster Corps is responsible for keeping equipment and supplies functioning and available to the officers and their troops, and transporting supplies to new locations.
